title: Font for High Yield Plus logo
content:
Please help me identify this font

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Logo HYP.png](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=Logo%20HYP.png) | 41.81 KB |
author: yayita

comments.content: You are the best!!!! Thank you
That bold weight looks surprisingly contemporary for a typeface designed in the early 1900s.

\> Stephen  
Wasn’t there an ITC version back in the seventies ?
Probably, but the original design is circa 1910.

Exactly 1908.  
I was pointing to the ITC version as a possible explanation for the “not-as-old-as-you’d-think” look.
